Now is the time to tell our elected officials our goals for democracy.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Monday marked the start of the 2019 Kansas Legislative session. Join us January 24 as we take action to uphold our New Year's resolution to fight for Voting Rights like our democracy depends on it.

Our goal is simple: we want to cut the unnecessary red tape and fix the broken processes that keep thousands of Kansans away from the ballot box and out of the democratic process.

Join the Kansas Coalition for Citizen Participation at the Kansas State Capitol on Thursday, January 24 for our 2019 Lobby Day.

We're more fired up than ever, but we know enacting meaningful reform to increase citizen participation won't be easy. That's why we need your help. In order to increase civic engagement in our elections, we need to show our elected officials that Kansans from all across the state are demanding a fairer and healthier democracy that gives all citizens a voice.

Kansas Coalition for Citizen
Participation Lobby Day

Hold your elected officials accountable for a better democracy in Kansas.

Thursday, January 24, 9 a.m. - 2 p.m.
Kansas State Capitol
SW 8th & SW Van Buren
Topeka, KS 66612

RSVP TODAY

Our day will start at 9 a.m. SHARP at the State Capitol Auditorium with a brief training on the issues, priorities, and how to talk to your legislators. As the day proceeds, you'll have the opportunity to meet other passionate Kansans from around the state and visit with your local legislators to share why increasing citizen participation is vital to creating a healthier state.

We look forward to seeing you there,

Ellen Glover
Field Director, ACLU of Kansas
